chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
A: list X
x: X

Goal:
x :: A <> A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
nil_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), [] <> x :: l
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
List.list_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall l l' : list A, {l = l'} + {l <> l'}
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
not_in_cons : forall (A : Type) (x a : A) (l : list A), ~ x el a :: l < -> x <> a /\ ~ x el l
count_occ_cons_neq : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> count_occ eq_dec (x :: l) y = count_occ eq_dec l y
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
Tauto.cnf = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.cnf (_ _)%type_scope
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
remove_cons : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (x : A) (l : list A), remove eq_dec x (x :: l) = remove eq_dec x l
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> [] -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ [a]}}
in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {a el l} + {~ a el l}
count_occ_cons_eq : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x = y -> count_occ eq_dec (x :: l) y = S (count_occ eq_dec l y)
NoDup_nodup : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A), NoDup (nodup decA l)
nodup_inv : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (k l : list A) (a : A), nodup decA k = a :: l -> ~ a el l
RingMicromega.PolC = fun C : Type => EnvRing.Pol C : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.PolC _%type_scope
Relation_Operators.Ltl_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Relation_Operators.Ltl_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
RingMicromega.NFormula = fun C : Type => (RingMicromega.PolC C * RingMicromega.Op1)%type : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.NFormula _%type_scope
hd_error_some_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), hd_error l = Some a -> l <> []
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
removelast_app : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l' <> [] -> removelast (l ++ l') = l ++ removelast l'
app_removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), l <> [] -> l = removelast l ++ [last l d]
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = []}
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA [] (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b ->...-> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
Relation_Operators.Lt_tl : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y)
in_split : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), x el l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ x :: l2

```coq
unfold not; intros.
induction A.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. apply IHl. auto.
Qed.
